emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Software Development
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems that can autonomously write, debug, and deploy code with minimal human intervention, enhancing productivity and reducing errors.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Shift in job roles for developers, potential increase in software quality, ethical considerations regarding AI-generated code.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Ease of integration with existing development workflows, trust in AI capabilities, regulatory compliance for automated systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Fully Autonomous Vehicles
emerging_technologies.description: Vehicles capable of operating in all conditions without human input, leading to reduced accidents and optimized traffic flow.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduction in transportation jobs, changes in urban design, privacy concerns from constant data collection.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Legislative approval, public trust in autonomous safety, infrastructure readiness.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural-Cloud Interfaces
emerging_technologies.description: Direct brain-to-cloud interfaces allowing for seamless interaction with digital environments, enhancing cognitive abilities through augmented reality.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Privacy issues, ethical considerations about cognitive enhancement, potential for digital divide.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological maturity, regulatory frameworks for brain interfaces, public acceptance of invasive technology.

emerging_technologies.name: Space Resource Utilization
emerging_technologies.description: Technologies for harvesting and processing resources from space, focusing initially on water ice mining on the moon.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Economic shifts due to new resource availability, geopolitical competition for space resources.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Cost-effectiveness, international space law, technological reliability.

emerging_technologies.name: Zero-Waste Manufacturing
emerging_technologies.description: Advanced manufacturing processes that recycle all by-products, reducing environmental impact to near zero.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduction in landfill waste, new business models for manufacturers, potential job shifts.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Economic incentives, regulatory support, technological scalability.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Powered Smart Cities
mainstream_technologies.description: Cities using AI to optimize everything from traffic to waste management, enhancing urban living.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption in major metropolitan areas, with ongoing integration in smaller cities.

mainstream_technologies.name: Blockchain for Digital Identity
mainstream_technologies.description: Use of blockchain to manage digital identities, ensuring privacy and security in digital transactions.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Integrated into financial services, government systems, and increasingly in personal data management.

epoch_themes.description: A period marked by significant advancements in AI and autonomous systems, transforming various sectors.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Increased automation leading to job displacement, but also new job creation in AI management and oversight.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Rise of AI ethics as a major field, increased investment in AI education and research.

epoch_themes.description: Focus on technologies that reduce environmental impact and promote sustainability.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Shift towards circular economies, regulatory changes to support sustainable practices.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push for green technologies, international agreements on sustainability targets.
